title: States of Matter and Properties

vocab.definition: Matter that has a definite shape and takes up a definite amount of space
Matter that takes the shape of its container but has a definite volume
Matter that spreads out to fill its container completely
A characteristic that describes how something looks, feels, or acts

teachingNotes: Use hands-on experiments with ice, water, and steam. Let students observe and compare different materials and their properties.

sample.question: Name the three main states of matter
Is a rock a solid or liquid?
Is milk a solid or liquid?
What do we call the air around us?

truefalse.question: Water can be found in all three states of matter.
Steam is water in a gas state.
You can pick up a gas with your hands.

multiplechoice.question: Which property best describes a liquid?
choices: Takes the shape of its container

multiplechoice.question: What happens when you heat water?
